candidates.statement: Risk/Impact: if third-party export is not reliable, platform must pre-cache exports earlier or enforce cutoff policy.

candidates.statement: Legacy editing policy is a design-exit decision (OQ-A-0002) but must be deterministic in both UI and APIs:

candidates.statement: Must satisfy constraint engine at save time.

candidates.statement: New designs must not depend on third-party (NFR-0002).

candidates.statement: Legacy orderability policy for third-party outage must cover first-time export scenarios via pre-generation, migration, and/or alternate retained artifact workflow.

candidates.statement: Legacy export artifact retention duration must be explicit and policy-enforced; minimum guidance is >= 12 months pending OQ-A-0004 confirmation.

candidates.statement: Preview and export workloads must support horizontal scaling and should not block interactive editing.

candidates.statement: Must persist editable state and binary artifacts for months.
candidates.raw_text: Must persist editable state and binary artifacts for months.

candidates.statement: Exports must be reproducible for a saved design state.

candidates.statement: Legacy designs must remain orderable for retention window and rely on immutable third-party service.

candidates.statement: Styles/spaces are versioned; saved designs must remain compatible.

candidates.statement: Legacy edit behavior must be deterministic and reflected in UI routing, API contracts, and persisted metadata.
